Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis with part of handle; interior glazed streaky black; top of rim reserved with single row of black dots; exterior: below rim, streaky glaze band; below, black-figure decoration consisting of head and part of body of lion, to left with red on mane and chest; rosette with red on alternate petals as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The suggested dates for the Polos Painter are c. 585-550 BC (Möller 2000, 226) and c. 575-565 BC (Boardman, J., Athenian Black Figure Vases. London, 1974, 19).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 335, no. B391)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 151, note 67, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0774) (Phase 1)
